data.title: Bands that you thought were a single person and vice versa
data.meta_description: Sometimes bands have a name that makes you think it's a single person (Buffalo Springfield, Lukas Graham) or a single artist uses a moniker that sounds like a name of a band (Passenger for example).
data.text:
Post by Harx on

Sometimes bands have a name that makes you think it's a single person (Buffalo Springfield, Lukas Graham) or a single artist uses a moniker that sounds like a name of a band (Passenger for example). Have you ever confused a single artist with a band or vice versa?

Post by Zach on

I fully thought The Ready Set was a band to the extent that I even had a name in my head for another member (Daniel). Where I got that name from I'm still trying to figure out to this day.

My friend just learned that Bon Jovi (the band) is in fact constituted of multiple people a few weeks ago.

Post by Leaf on

Thought was a band:

Five for Fighting

Thought was a person:

Bon Jovi

Van Halen

Marilyn Manson (although he has also been solo)

Bon Iver

Post by lyhom on

I thought that salt ashes and marina & the diamonds were a band

I thought that bob moses was a person

Post by Harx on

I have just recently found out that Carlos Santana was in a band called Santana.

Post by Sambalada on

I thought that salt ashes and marina & the diamonds were a band

I thought that bob moses was a person

it's not a group?! :X

I've just figured it out now

Post by Zach on

I thought that bob moses was a person

Hold on just one second! Bob Moses is a duo?!

Post by yuh yuh on

At first I though Cascada was only one singer (but is an Euro-Dance group, consisting of 3 persons)

Post by Harx on

I thought The Weeknd was a band

Same here, but that's because there was a terrible band in my country of this name (except it was The Weekend, not The Weeknd), that's why I had this association in my mind when I first heard of him when "Love Me Harder" became a hit.

Post by MTSChart21 on

I thought that salt ashes and marina & the diamonds were a band

I thought that bob moses was a person

it's not a group?! :X

I've just figured it out now

Wow, same. I seriously thought it was a group...

Post by Ling-Ling on

I thought La Roux was one person when they came out. Now they are, haha. So I don't feel so bad.

I thought Goldfrapp was a solo act as well.

And I also thought Marina & The Diamonds was a band.

Post by YourFaveIsAFlop on

it's not a group?! :X

I've just figured it out now

Wow, same. I seriously thought it was a group...

The Diamonds are her fans, not her band.

Post by Zach on

Wow, same. I seriously thought it was a group...

The Diamonds are her fans, not her band.

Mind blown.

Post by Harx on

-Gnarls Barkley

Oh yes

When I found out it was CeeLo Green singing it blew my mind. I thought it was a person for almost a decade.

Post by YourFaveIsAFlop on

Where would you guys put the Pussycat Dolls? Technically they're a band because all of the girls are members, but all of the vocals are Nicole's...so...

Post by Az Paynter on

Nicole didn't do 100% of the PCD's vocals. I mean, Melody got a few adlibs here and there. :sip2:

Post by Linnethia Monique on

Nicole didn't do 100% of the PCD's vocals. I mean, Melody got a few adlibs here and there. :sip2:

My girl had verses and bridges on the 2nd album

Post by Relaxing Cup on

Nicole didn't do 100% of the PCD's vocals. I mean, Melody got a few adlibs here and there. :sip2:

My girl had verses and bridges on the 2nd album

Post by trustypepper on

Lol I remember on Behind the Music when Nicole "revealed" that she was the only one doing vocals. She was so dramatic about it.

Post by chicken077 on

I didn't know Rae Sremmurd was a duo and not a person until like two days ago.

Post by Deleted on

I thought the Tony Rich Project (everyone's favorite thing: a OHW) was a group, but it was just one guy trying to pass himself off as a group because he thought people would take him more seriously than if they knew he was a soloist.

Conversely, I thought Florence + the Machine was the stage name for one woman.

Post by Sherane Lamar on

Owl City.

I still don't buy the idea that Lukas Graham is a band. He might have some instrumentalists following him around, but the song is about when HE was 7 years old. And what HIS mama said to him. Not anybody else. So I'm not buying it. Is Drake a band just because he usually works with Noah Shebib? I don't think so. So I don't buy the idea that he is a band.

Same with La Roux. "English singer and songwriter La Roux has released two studio albums, one mix album, two extended plays, one mixtape, five singles, two promotional singles and seven music videos." lol.
